result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:25 AM Defendant William E Combs Jr in court.  Attorney John Paul Marchan in court for William E Combs Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 01:20 PM Defendant William E Combs in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court takes a short recess at 1:22 PM to allow the defendant time to complete a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.  Matter recalled at 1:53 PM with the same appearances.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing August 15, 2022.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  The Court will allow for the defendant to appear by Zoom at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Victims appear via zoom, request from DA's office - Victim Witness Unit. Sent to Herring for review. - GRANTED per Court
Hearing on July 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendnat is not to use/possess any electronic application that has the ability of deleting an image upon opening.

10:16 AM Defendant William E Combs in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Filed by defendant requesting to adjourn court date.

   **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 07-07-2022. DENIED**
